name: PTAnywhere performance testing
tagline: Project created to measure the performance of the Docker-based Packet Tracer.
body:
<script src="https://cdnjs.cloudflare.com/ajax/libs/Chart.js/1.0.2/Chart.min.js"></script>

In this __performance-testing__ project we will try to analyse how well the Docker-based Packet Tracer solution proposed in [PTAnywhere](https://github.com/PTAnywhere) can scale.

# Disk size
<canvas id="diskChart" width="400" height="400"></canvas>

<script>
// Get the context of the canvas element we want to select
var ctx = document.getElementById("diskChart").getContext("2d");
var data = {
    labels: ["January", "February", "March", "April", "May", "June", "July"],
    datasets: [
        {
            label: "My First dataset",
            fillColor: "rgba(220,220,220,0.2)",
            strokeColor: "rgba(220,220,220,1)",
            pointColor: "rgba(220,220,220,1)",
            pointStrokeColor: "#fff",
            pointHighlightFill: "#fff",
            pointHighlightStroke: "rgba(220,220,220,1)",
            data: [65, 59, 80, 81, 56, 55, 40]
        },
        {
            label: "My Second dataset",
            fillColor: "rgba(151,187,205,0.2)",
            strokeColor: "rgba(151,187,205,1)",
            pointColor: "rgba(151,187,205,1)",
            pointStrokeColor: "#fff",
            pointHighlightFill: "#fff",
            pointHighlightStroke: "rgba(151,187,205,1)",
            data: [28, 48, 40, 19, 86, 27, 90]
        }
    ]
};
var myNewChart = new Chart(ctx).Line(data);
</script>


# External (useful) references
About the [Docker remote API](https://docs.docker.com/reference/api/docker_remote_api/):
  * [Python library](https://github.com/docker/docker-py)
  * [Configure Docker to allow remote access](https://coreos.com/os/docs/latest/customizing-docker.html)
  * [Alternative configuration](https://docs.docker.com/articles/configuring/) (or check this _/usr/lib/systemd/system/docker.service_)

How to __take measures__ in/about Docker?
 * The [stats command](https://docs.docker.com/reference/api/docker_remote_api_v1.19/#get-container-stats-based-on-resource-usage) might be particularly useful.
 * [Browser benchmarking which could be used as reference](http://www.xataka.com/aplicaciones/asi-esta-la-lucha-por-ser-el-navegador-mas-rapido-y-ligero-en-tu-escritorio)
 * [Monitoring alternatives for Docker](http://rancher.com/comparing-monitoring-options-for-docker-deployments/)
 * Networking
  * [On the delay added by Docker in networking](http://stackoverflow.com/questions/21889053/what-is-the-runtime-performance-cost-of-a-docker-container)
 * [Memory](https://github.com/PTAnywhere/performance-testing/issues/4)
 * [Disk](https://github.com/PTAnywhere/performance-testing/issues/2)
 * [CPU](https://github.com/PTAnywhere/performance-testing/issues/9)
